QUES_1: A man had been killed on a Ferris wheel. Where did he receive the fatal wound?
QUES_2: The victim was shot from outside the Ferris wheel car. How did the investigator know that?
QUES_4: The helicopter is hovering at the same height as the Ferris wheel cart. There are sketchy men in the other cart; but they can't be the shooter because it would've shattered the window of their cart?
ANS_1: There's a gunshot wound the side of the victim's head. This must be it.
ANS_2: The window of the car was broken. The bullet shot its way in through this window
ANS_3: The helicopter is hovering at the same height as the Ferris wheel cart. There are sketchy men in the other cart; but they can't be the shooter because it would've shattered the window of their cart.
ANS_4: The victim was killed by the gang members in the next car. The victim became too intimate with their boss's woman. This made the woman to believe her happiness with an ordinary man was a mere fantasy. She decided to live out her life by spending all of the boss's money.
HINT_4: The gang members in the next car

QUES_1: Someone phoned the police about a dead body floating on the pond. When they arrived at the scene; they knew that the victim was the park employee. How did they know that?
QUES_2: The boat floating near the body is the one they rent out at this park. Other park rangers are sure that they locked the boat away at the end of the day. How did the boat get out?
QUES_3: Police then found something near the body which led them to believe that someone had been there at the time of the victim's death. What was the item they found?
QUES_4: Something in the scene tells us about the relationship between the victim and the person who accompanied him. Which item is it?
ANS_1: The victim is wearing a jacket which says PARK RANGER; the uniform worn by none other than the park's employees.
ANS_2: There are keys attached to the man's belt. He must have opened the shed and brought it to the pond. But why would he do that after the park had closed?
ANS_3: A feminine glove is floating by the body. The victim is wearing gloves on both of his hands so this can't be his. And the design doesn't seem to match his taste... There may have been someone else with him.
ANS_4: A ring box is floating on the water. Turns out that the victim took his girlfriend out for a boat ride after the park closed. His girlfriend confessed that she had refused his marriage proposal which enraged him. In fear; she jumped off of the boat and swam away; not realizing that the boat had turned over. The victim couldn't swim so he drowned helplessly.

QUES_1: A fisher found a dead body at the lake. He knew the woman inside of the boat was dead by one glance. How did he know?
QUES_2: Police easily found the owner of the boat. Which part of the scene helped them?
QUES_3: The fisher was the first suspect. However; as soon as they saw that the boat had been brought to the lake from somewhere else; he was ruled out as a suspect. Why?
QUES_4: How did the police know that the boat was brought to the lake from elsewhere? The clue can be seen on the boat itself.
ANS_1: There's a knife stuck in the victim's chest which was visible even from afar. He called the police immediately.
ANS_2: Small boats are required to have vessel ID number displayed. Police tracked down its owner and began investigating on the owner's son as the suspect.
ANS_3: The bicycle by the lake belongs to the fisherman. In fact; some of his fishing gears are still on it. Since it would be difficult to bring the boat to the lake with that bicycle along with the fishing gears; police decided to rule him out as a suspect.
ANS_4: The barnacles covering the bottom of the boat suggest that the boat had been brought from seashore since barnacles don't live in freshwater. It turns out that the owner's son and the victim were colleagues. He murdered her when she rejected his love. He staged the scene by bringing in the boat; but alas; it didn't really help.

QUES_1: Someone snatched a women purse on the street. Which vehicle on the street belongs to the snatcher?
QUES_2: Why was the woman walking on the right side of the road with no sidewalk? Find her reason from the picture.
QUES_3: Police easily came up with a list of suspects; thanks to the woman sharing what she remembered about the snatcher. What exactly did she remember?
QUES_4: She also remembered that it was a black motobike and there two person on it. Unfortunately; she doesn't remember the motobike make nor the model. But the scene of the crime reveals which car the snatcher was on. Was the snatcher on A or B?
ANS_1: A bicycle had just passed by the woman; but she's not looking at that direction. She is looking at the red car in front of her.
ANS_2: There was roadwork being held on the sidewalk. This also narrowed the space between pedestrians and vehicles; making it easier for the snatcher to take the woman's purse.
ANS_3: She remembered the license plate on the snatcher's car which helped police to narrow down their list of suspects to 2 which had same numbers for their cars
ANS_4: The snatcher had to be sitting on the right side to snatch the purse; so the answer is B. Further investigation revealed that B was a repeat offender in this area. Although he's rich enough to ride a nice car; he snatched purses to laugh at the look on his victims' faces.

QUES_1: A woman is found dead on a crowded beach. A woman was found dead on a crowded beach. She seemed to suffocate to death; what at the scene could be a weapon?
QUES_2: Seems like the victim used her last strength to leave a clue on her murderer. Where is it?
QUES_3: The victim was at the beach with 4 friends. Police suspects the one with initials B and 0. But... Oh no! All of them have B in their names. Which one of them should police question?
QUES_4: Why did Bob murder his girlfriend? There is a clue on his motive in the picture?
ANS_1: There was a towel by the girl's side. Maybe the perpetrator used the same scarf to strangle the girl; choking the girl. On the girl's neck there was still a red band.
ANS_2: Letters B.O. are written on the sand. Police suspects that there may be at least 2 culprits. One of which must have B in their name.
ANS_3: Without the periods; the letters on the sand would read BO meaning the murderer must have those two letters in their name. Bob is the only one that fits that condition. Police also found out that Bob and the victim had been in a relationship.
ANS_4: Bob was dating the victim and Beth at the same time. When the victim confronted him about it; He used a scarf to try to strangle his girlfriend. He tried justifying his action saying; I just wanted that girl to shut up. I didn't mean to kill her though.
HINT_4: The hand of Bob and Beth

QUES_1: A burnt body of a gofler was found on a gold course. Police Speculate this man was electrocuted by a lightening. Which part of the scene shows that a lightening had struck near him?
QUES_2: Was the weather bad at the time of the accident? Does anything in the scene indiacte that?
QUES_3: Although there are many tall trees on the golf course. The lightening specifically struck the golfer. Why?
QUES_4: Police said that this was not a simple lightning accident. Instead; Someone immobilized the man earlier and led the light to attack him. What led the police to this conclusion?
ANS_1: The lightning shaped marks in the grass show that the golfer was hit by lightning and died.
ANS_2: The puddle of water next to the body of golfer indicates that the weather was bad during the incident. The ground must have been wet; too.
ANS_3: The lightning specifically struck the golfer; despite the tall trees; because of the golf club planted in the ground next to him. Golf clubs are metal; and metal attracts lightning.
ANS_4: Police conclude that the man was immobilized before the lightning strike by being hit over the head with another golf club; which is laying on the ground bent next to him.
HINT_3: Golf club planted in the ground

QUES_1: Police received a call at night from a nurse reporting on a death of a female doctor. upon arriving the hospital; what did the police find to be the cause of her death?
QUES_2: The Murderer seems to be injured. How did police know that?
QUES_3: How did the murderer get injured?
QUES_4: She was killed by someone working at the hospital but not by a patient. What item in the room prompted the investigator to think so?
ANS_1: On the girl who had no wounds; she died from poison; there was a used needle next to the female doctor as evidence..
ANS_2: The blood smear on the ground is indication that the assailant was injured; because the victim fought back.
ANS_3: The murderer was injured by the pen that the doctor was holding; and is still holding even after her death.
ANS_4: She was killed by someone working at the hospital; due to the open book on her desk. The book indicates that she was on her break at the time.

QUES_1: A young Woman was found dead on a rainny night. The investigator arrived at the scene at midnight. Where is the fatal Wound?
QUES_2: An Artist living in the neighborhood found the body when he visited to return a book he borrowed from the victim. The investigator wonders if the artist had been exercising untill his arrival. What made him think so?
QUES_3: The investigator assumed the woman was murdered outside then brought home. What led him to this thought?
QUES_4: Neighbors said they saw victims go out in the morning before it started to rain. This made investigators suspect the artist for the murder. Where is the proof of it?
ANS_1: The woman’s fatal wound is on her forehead.
ANS_2: The artist is the sweating; panting guy in the black jacket. His panting makes the investigator wonder if he was exercising.
ANS_3: The woman was murdered outside because of the wet jacket that she was wearing.
ANS_4: The muddy footprints on the wooden floor in front of the house are clearly larger than a woman's; which is why the artist is a prime suspect.

QUES_1: The picture shows a robbery taking place in an office. Why could the robber easily sneak into the office like that
QUES_2: Which item made the robber think there was a large amount of cash in here?
QUES_3: The robber is rummaging through the office chief’s drawer for a particular item. The woman told him the drawer it was placed in. What’s he looking for?
QUES_4: Eventually the chief failed to steal the cash and was arrested; thanks to the woman’s smart move. What did she do?
ANS_1: The clock said 8 pm; the staff and office security were all gone; only one female employee stayed overtime
ANS_2: The big safe in the upper right corner of the office made the robber think that there is a lot of cash
ANS_3: The robber was looking through a specific drawer; because of the paper that says 1192; which is the code to the safe.
ANS_4: The phone is the reason that the woman was able to stop the robber. She called emergency and left the phone off the hook.

QUES_1: A woman was found dead from poisoning in her hotel suite. she had checked in by herself; but it’s obvious there was someone else in the room on the day of her death. How do we know this?
QUES_2: Police found something out of place. What is it?
QUES_3: The food doesn't seem to be touched yet. So where did the girl get poisoned from?
QUES_4: The Woman was killed by the hotel manager whom she had been dating. The manager’s handwriting was the key to solving this case. which item in the room might contain his handwriting?
ANS_1: The dinner table had two glasses on it; indicating that there were two people in the room at the time.
ANS_2: The ashtray has the hotel logo on it despite the no smoking sign; indicating that the assailant may have been a staff member.
ANS_3: The lipstick mark on the glass indicates that the girl may have had a glass of wine. Someone poisoned the girl's wine glass.
ANS_4: The love letter on the floor next to the woman would be the most likely item to contain the handwriting of the assailant.

QUES_1: A woman was strangled to death on the rooftop of a 10 story hotel. The examination of the scene revealed that the murderer was someone intimate with the victim. What suggests that?
QUES_2: hanging from the roof railing proves that the girl cannot do it herself; but must be done by the perpetrator. How could the perpetrator do so undetected?
QUES_3: According to the hotel staff; the victim was staying in Room 908 and had her window open. Which room is that in the picture?
QUES_4: The victim’s room is locked from inside and the key seems to be in the room. On her smartphone; there’s a call history of a call she had with the murderer. How did they get her to the rooftop?
ANS_1: The woman’s bathrobe indicates that she was intimate with the assailant.
ANS_2: the perpetrator might have stood on the table in the girl's room window to bring the girl from the window of the rooftop room to the railing.
ANS_3: The window that is all the way open is the one that the woman was staying in at the time of the crime.
ANS_4: The rope is the tool that allowed the assailant to get the victim to the rooftop.
HINT_3: The window that is all the way open

QUES_1: One winter day; the detective is examining a murder scene in a locked room. The victim; an up-and-coming physicist; was poisoned in her own lab. What was used to poison her?
QUES_2: The victim’s lab was unusually hot inside when the police arrived. Why could that be?
QUES_3: The lab was locked when her body was found. you have 3 clues: The unusually warm lab; the needle with a cork at the end; and the victim’s body. What was used to the victim in this locked room?
QUES_4: Why can the perpetrator calculate the correct position and time of the victim sitting in the chair when the kettle is boiling and needle on the victim's neck?
ANS_1: The needle with a fork in the neck of the victim is the clue to what poisoned her.
ANS_2: The space heater in her office was turned up and used to make the office extra hot.
ANS_3: The teapot on top of the space heater was used to do the crime. The heat expanded the vapors and shot the needle at her.
ANS_4: The tea cup is on the table with lipstick mark of the victim. The perpetrator put anesthetic in it.

QUES_1: There was a panic at the music hall when the opera singer suddenly collapsed. He was taken to ER but unfortunately passed away. Police currently suspect one of the band members. But why?
QUES_2: Police couldn’t find a device to shoot the arrow from the band member’s belongings. But there is one person who could’ve shot the arrow without such device. Who could that be?
QUES_3: what item in this room indiacates that the victim may have been intimate with one of the men here?
QUES_4: Why was the singer murdered? A certain item on his body gives a clues.
ANS_1: The arrow on the back made the police suspicious of the band members because they were all standing behind the singer
ANS_2: The harp player could have shot the arrow by using it as a makeshift bow.
ANS_3: The timpanist (drummer) on the right is laughing; indicating that he was the accomplice who distracted the conductor.
ANS_4: The singer  was killed due to the lipstick stain on his collar; indicating that he was having an affair.
HINT_4: the lipstick stain on his collar

QUES_1: A body was found in a horror museum. Visitors began to panic; but smart museum staff have this situation. What have museum staff done to convince visitors that the body is only part of the scene?
QUES_2: The body was identified to be a male staff who was in charge of this area. He was found wearing nothing but his underwear. Does this object in the scene belongs to him?
QUES_3: Suspecting that the uniform must belong to one of the female staff members; police questioned them but no one turned out suspicious. Maybe an outsider got a hold of the uniform. Which part in the picture hints at that?
QUES_4: Why should the attacker remove his skirt and cuffs the victim?
ANS_1: Museum staff set up a satan model to convince visitors that the murder was actually part of the scene.
ANS_2: The dress next to victim that someone else was there with the victim as well.
ANS_3: The dry cleaning box indicates that an outsider could have grabbed the uniform and stolen it.
ANS_4: The victim was bleeding so much that the attacker had to remove from the skirt and cuff of the victim's clothes.
